column3: Here we list the minimum number of global metadata that we would like to attach to any future mission. The name of the metadata is taken from SIOS (Svalbard Integrated Arctic Earth Observing System) when present. Then the ACDD name, the OGC CSW name, and the ISO19115 names are also reported. Color green means that the metadata should be mandatory, yellow optional, red not included, blue will be included in the future.

column4: Description
A brief title for the dataset.
A short summary for dataset, the content and potential linkages etc.
A comma separated list of key words and phrases.
column11: Note that ACDD and ISO has two field for keywords: one for the keywords and one to report the dictionary used for those keywords. SIOS only has one field. This is because SIOS requires GCMD Science keywords to be used. Link: https://www.earthdata.nasa.gov/learn/find-data/idn/gcmd-keywords

column4: A comma-separated list of the conventions that are followed by the dataset. For ACDD use 'ACDD-1.3'
Guideline for the words/phrases in your "keywords" attribute, if any
column11: Note that ACDD and ISO has two field for keywords: one for the keywords and one to report the dictionary used for those keywords. SIOS only has one field. This is because SIOS requires GCMD Science keywords to be used. Link: https://www.earthdata.nasa.gov/learn/find-data/idn/gcmd-keywords

column4: Name of the PI
Email to the PI
Affiliation of the PI
ISO8601 reference for the dataset
column11: ISO 8601:2004 date format, preferably the extended format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss<zone>

column4: ISO8601 reference for the dataset
Geographical northernmost position of the dataset (rectangular box)
column11: note that for ISO and ACDD coordinates box can be expressed using WKT as well, as a single field, or even as a simple vertical bounding box

column4: Geographical southernmost position of the dataset (rectangular box)
Further refinement of the box
Geographical easternmost position of the dataset, positive east of Greenwich.
Geographical westernmost position of the dataset, negative west of Greenwich.
Further refinement of the box
The date on which the data was created.
List of topic categories for the dataset
Language used in the dataset. Should be English
Name of the platform(s) that supported the sensor data used to create this data set or product.
column11: Note that ACDD also provides a field named platform_vocabulary to specify the vocabulary used. Where should we provide the dictionary?

column4:
The scientific project that produced the data. Multiple
names to be separated by comma.
column11: SIOS also has Project short name, for an Acronym for the project.

column4: Describe the restrictions to data access and distribution.
column11:
SIOS recommends Creative Commons BY which ensures proper
attribution of data providers.

column4: Version identifier of the data file or product as assigned by the data creator.
URL to the data center hosting the data.
URL to creator or to information
column11: SIOS does not have such URL but requires two other URLs, Data access (URL) and Related information (URL). Maybe one can be mapped

column4: The name of the controlled vocabulary from which variable standard names are taken.
Describes the duration of the data set. Use ISO 8601:2004 duration format.
Describes the targeted time period between each value in the data set. Use ISO 8601:2004 duration format.
An identifier for the data set, it can be the DOI as well.
A textual description of the processing (or quality control) level of the data.
Describes the numerically larger vertical limit
Describes the numerically smaller vertical limit
"up" or "down". If down, vertical values are interpreted as 'depth'
Further refinement of the box
Further refinement of the box

UTF-8

See code list at the end of SIOS doc

column4: See code list at the end of SIOS doc
See code list at the end of SIOS doc
which format?
An URL to the dataset.

A specification of the data access protocol, e.g. HTTP (for direct
download), OPeNDAP, OGC WMS.
A citation string for the dataset.
Acronym for the project.
column5: ISO and ACDD have project name only

column4: Keywords indicating the quality control of the dataset

column3: Elements found in copernicus example but not SIOS
column4: Description

column5: Not used anymore in latest ACDD version

column4: The data type, as derived from Unidata's Common Data Model Scientific Data types and understood by THREDDS. (This is a THREDDS "dataType", and is different from the CF NetCDF attribute 'featureType', which indicates a Discrete Sampling Geometry file in CF.)
column5: Probably can be mapped to distribution format of SIoS!

column4: Miscellaneous information about the data, not captured elsewhere. This attribute is defined in the CF Conventions.
Service desk
Information about the targeted spacing of points in latitude. Recommend describing resolution as a number value followed by the units. Examples: '100 meters', '0.1 degree'
Provides an audit trail for modifications to the original data. This attribute is also in the NetCDF Users Guide:

Published or web-based references that describe the data or methods used to produce it. Recommend URIs (such as a URL or DOI) for papers or other references. This attribute is defined in the CF conven
column5: Can be mapped to one of the URL required by SIOS.

column4: software version

The method of production of the original data. If it was model-generated, source should name the model and its version. If it is observational, source should characterize it. This attribute is defined in the CF Conventions. Examples: 'temperature from CTD #1234'; 'world model v.0.1'.
column5: present also on acdd. Might be mapped to activity type

column3: Elements found in ACDD and ISO only
column4: Description

The organization that provides the initial id (see above) for the dataset. The naming authority should be uniquely specified by this attribute. We recommend using reverse-DNS naming for the naming authority; URIs are also acceptable. Example: 'edu.ucar.unidata'.
A place to acknowledge various types of support for the project that produced this data.
The name of the person (or other entity specified by the publisher_type attribute) responsible for publishing the data file or product to users, with its current metadata and format.
The email address of the person (or other entity specified by the publisher_type attribute) responsible for publishing the data file or product to users, with its current metadata and format.
To describe geographical extension with WKT format
further info on creator and publisher

The overarching program(s) of which the dataset is a part. A program consists of a set (or portfolio) of related and possibly interdependent projects that meet an overarching objective. Examples: 'GHRSST', 'NOAA CDR', 'NASA EOS', 'JPSS', 'GOES-R'.
name and role of any individuals, projects, or institutions that contributed to the creation of this data.
The date on which the metadata was last modified. The ISO 8601:2004 extended date format is recommended, as described in the Attributes Content Guidance section.
Name of the contributing instrument(s) or sensor(s) used to create this data set or product. Indicate controlled vocabulary used in instrument_vocabulary.
A URL that gives the location of more complete metadata. A persistent URL is recommended for this attribute.
